item.description:
My teacher, Grandmaster Yuanming Zhang is giving a mini-workshop on Friday Feb. 24 from 7:30-9:00 pm and I thought it would be a good opportunity to combine it with a Meetup! Since I have to rent a room, there will be a $5.00 fee. Please let me know if you have any questions. I hope to see you there.

 

Introduction To Daoist Essential Oil Qigong

For thousands of years, Daoist practitioners and recluses have been at the forefront of integrating holistic medicine with energy work and self-cultivation.  From the first works on the medicinal properties of plants to the search for the purest herbs for elixirs to prolong life, improve health, and heighten awareness, these masters integrated the bounty of the natural world into their martial, healing, and self-cultivation arts.  Today, contemporary scientific advances have identified the healing compounds of many plants and developed means of extracting them as essential oils that can be used topically, aromatically, and internally to help treat a variety of illnesses, imbalances, and ailments, creating a powerful tool for Qigong practitioners.

This workshop will introduce how to integrate certified pure therapeutic grade essential oils into Qigong practices to cleanse, balance, restore, and energize the human body and open higher states of mental acuity, emotional awareness, and spiritual consciousness. All required materials will be provided free of charge to participants.

 Although I've studied with him for 10 years, this will be the first time I've seen him incorporate essential oils into the practice, and it will be interesting to see how that works. Translation will be provided by one of Master Zhang's other students, who's been studying with him for 14 years!

Master Zhang will also be giving more detailed workshops in traditional Daoist Qigong and Tai Chi on Saturday and Sunday. For workshop descriptions and registration information, see http://www.qigongmaster.com.


Location:

BodyMind Integration Center
118 Main St #1B (2nd floor)
Watertown, MA 02472-4425

The BodyMind Integration Center is a short walk from Watertown Square, opposite the Public Library.  It's on the #70/70A bus line from Central Square Cambridge to Waltham, MA and a short walk from the #71 and other Watertown Square bus stops.  Parking is available off Pleasant St. in the upper lot behind the building. 

Map:  http://maps.google.com/maps?q=118+Main+St,+Watertown,+MA&hl=en&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=36.368578,71.542969&hnear=118+Main+St,+Watertown,+Massachusetts+02472&t=m&z=16
item.name: Integrating Essential Oils Into Qigong Practice
